title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0202

segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
And my name is Catherine.
And today we've got a great lesson for you about traveling and getting directions.
segments.cn: 今天我们有一节关于旅行和问路的精彩课程。

segments.en: That's right.
So sometimes we are looking for an address, we are looking for our friend's house and we can't find it.
segments.cn: 有时我们在找地址，找朋友的家，却找不到。

segments.en: So what do you have to do?
You have to stop and ask someone for directions.
It's actually a joke in many countries that men hate to ask for directions.
segments.cn: 在很多国家，男人不喜欢问路，这其实是个笑话。

segments.en: And so this is the women's approach.
Asking and getting directions and finally finding your way.
segments.cn: 问路、获取方向，最终找到你的路。

segments.en: So it's a good thing.
That's a very good thing.
So we're going to jump right into the dialogue.
segments.cn: 现在我们直接进入对话。

segments.en: Let's see what happens here and if they can find the place they're looking for.
segments.cn: 让我们看看这里发生了什么，他们能否找到他们要去的地方。

segments.en: We've been going around in circles for the past hour.
segments.cn: 我们已经转了一个小时的圈。

segments.en: Will you just please stop and ask for directions?
We are not lost.
I'm just taking the scenic route.
Yeah, whatever.
I told you we should buy that GPS that was on sale.
segments.cn: 我告诉过你，我们应该买那个打折的GPS。

segments.en: But would you listen to me?
No, this is so typical.
Fine, I'll ask this guy for directions if it will shut your trap.
segments.cn: 好吧，如果这能让你闭嘴，我就问这个家伙路。

segments.en: Excuse me sir, can you tell me how to get to St. Mary's Church?
segments.cn: 劳驾，先生，您能告诉我怎么去圣玛丽教堂吗？

segments.en: Sure.
Go down Park Road, turn left, go up as far as the set of traffic lights and turn left.
segments.cn: 沿Park Road走，左转，走到红绿灯处再左转。

segments.en: The place you're looking for is the second building on the right.
segments.cn: 你要找的地方是右边第二栋建筑。

segments.en: Thanks.
See, was that hard?
If you would only listen to me more often, you would be better off.
segments.cn: 如果你能多听我几次，你会更好。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
So, well, the woman was obviously a little bit angry that the guy refused to admit that he was lost.
segments.cn: 所以，那个女人显然有点生气，因为那个男人拒绝承认他迷路了。

segments.en: That's right, she's very frustrated and this has been in movies and in books and all sorts of things.
segments.cn: 没错，她非常沮丧，这在电影和书籍中都出现过。

segments.en: This kind of story of the man not wanting to ask for directions.
segments.cn: 这种男人不愿意问路的故事。

segments.en: And so he keeps saying, listen, I've got these excuses.
segments.cn: 所以他一直在说，听着，我有这些借口。

segments.en: I'm taking the scenic route, for example.
segments.cn: 我在走风景路线，比如说。

segments.en: That's right, and that's our first word for today on language takeaway.
segments.cn: 没错，这就是我们今天的第一个单词，语言收获。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
So as you say, the scenic route, what does he mean by that?
segments.cn: 你说的风景路线，他是什么意思？

segments.en: Okay, route is like a path or a trail or kind of like the way that you go somewhere.
segments.cn: 好吧，路线就像一条路径或小径，或者说是你去某个地方的方式。

segments.en: So the route's to my house.
But in this case, the scenic route or the scenic route, you can say in both ways, is the most beautiful way to go.
segments.cn: 但在这种情况下，风景路线或风景路线，你可以这样说，是最美丽的去法。

segments.en: It's usually the longer one.
So you can say, oh, it's just the scenic route.
segments.cn: 所以你可以说，哦，这只是风景路线。

segments.en: It's not really true.
It's just the longer route.
Right, exactly.
So that's the excuse that he's giving her.
segments.cn: 所以这就是他给她的借口。

segments.en: He's like, no, I'm not lost.
We're taking longer because, well, we're taking the beautiful route.
segments.cn: 我们花更长时间是因为，我们走的是美丽的路线。

segments.en: Alright, with all the trees and the animals and the lakes.
segments.cn: 好吧，满是树木、动物和湖泊。

segments.en: No, I don't buy it.
I don't believe this.
That's right.
And she said, yeah, whatever.
You know what?
We need a GPS.
Okay, GPS, Global Positioning System.
So many people have these in their cars these days.
segments.cn: 现在很多人车里都有这个。

segments.en: This is like an electronic map that will use your location to show you where to go.
segments.cn: 这就像一个电子地图，会使用你的位置信息来告诉你该去哪里。

segments.en: It's very useful.
And especially in places like the United States that have streets that are clearly marked and it's just a little bit easier to get around.
segments.cn: 尤其是在像美国这样的地方，街道标识清晰，出行更方便。

segments.en: You know, you can just get in your car, type in the address you want to go to, and the thing talks to you.
segments.cn: 你知道，你只需上车，输入你想去的地址，设备就会告诉你。

segments.en: It says turn left, go straight, turn right.
Creepy.
So this is a very useful device.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个非常有用的设备。

segments.en: It's like a computer that you use in your computer.
segments.cn: 就像你在电脑上使用的计算机。

segments.en: A GPS.
Alright, so she's talking about the GPS.
And then at the end of that line, she says, this is so typical.
segments.cn: 然后在那句话的最后，她说，这太典型了。

segments.en: So what?
Getting lost, alright?
Getting lost is so typical.
So something that is typical is common.
segments.cn: 所以典型的东西是常见的。

segments.en: Because this is so normal.
This is so typical.
This is so something you normally do.
segments.cn: 这就是你通常会做的事情。

segments.en: So what other examples could we give with the word typical?
segments.cn: 那么我们可以用典型这个词给出什么其他例子呢？

segments.en: Something that is typical.
Okay, well, you can have a behavior like this.
segments.cn: 好吧，你可以有这样的行为。

segments.en: What he did was typical.
We can also say, in my typical Saturday, I wake up late and drink a coffee and take a nap.
segments.cn: 我们也可以说，在我典型的星期六，我晚起，喝咖啡，打个盹。

segments.en: Okay, cool.
So it's common, it's regular, it's frequent, maybe.
segments.cn: 所以这是常见的，常规的，可能是频繁的。

segments.en: That's right.
Or you know, you go out to dinner and your friend is late.
segments.cn: 或者你知道，你出去吃晚餐，你的朋友迟到了。

segments.en: You say, this is so typical of him.
Right, he's always late.
Very good.
Alright, and we have one last set of words here.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们还有最后一组词。

segments.en: And when the guy was giving him instructions, he said, you know what, go left, go right, whatever.
segments.cn: 当那个男人给他指示时，他说，你知道，左转、右转，随便。

segments.en: And then he said, until you reach the set of traffic lights.
segments.cn: 然后他说，直到你到达红绿灯。

segments.en: So what is a traffic light?
Well, you know what a light is.
You know what traffic is.
Traffic is cars driving on the road, trucks, things like that.
segments.cn: 交通是路上行驶的汽车、卡车等。

segments.en: So traffic light is a special light with three colors, red, yellow and green.
segments.cn: 所以红绿灯是一种特殊的灯，有三种颜色，红色、黄色和绿色。

segments.en: And it tells you if you can stop or go.
segments.cn: 它告诉你是否可以停或走。

segments.en: So they're also called stop lights.
segments.cn: 所以它们也被称为停车灯。

segments.en: That's right.
Okay, so stop lights and traffic lights is the same thing.
segments.cn: 好的，停车灯和交通灯是一样的。

segments.en: Usually they hang from above the street.
segments.cn: 通常它们悬挂在街道上方。

segments.en: Okay, very good words and phrases there.
segments.cn: 好的，这里有很好的词汇和短语。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to our dialogue again?
And we'll be back in just a little bit.
We've been going around in circles for the past hour.
segments.cn: 我们已经转了一个小时的圈。

segments.en: Will you just please stop and ask for directions?
segments.cn: 你能不能停下来问一下路？

segments.en: We are not lost.
I'm just taking the scenic route.
Yeah, whatever.
I told you we should buy that GPS that was on sale.
segments.cn: 我告诉过你我们应该买那个打折的GPS。

segments.en: But would you listen to me?
No, this is so typical.
Fine.
I'll ask this guy for directions if it will shut your trap.
segments.cn: 如果能让你闭嘴，我就问这个家伙路。

segments.en: Excuse me, sir.
Can you tell me how to get to St. Mary's Go down Park Road, turn left, go up as far as the set of traffic lights and turn left.
segments.cn: 你能告诉我怎么去圣玛丽吗？沿着公园路走，左转，走到交通信号灯处再左转。

segments.en: The place you're looking for is the second building on the right.
segments.cn: 你要找的地方是右边第二栋建筑。

segments.en: Thanks.
See, was that hard?
If you would only listen to me more often, you'd be better off.
segments.cn: 如果你能多听我几次，你会更好。

segments.en: All right, so we've got some great phrases coming up in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们在流利表达中有一些很棒的短语。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
So the first phrase that we're going to look at is what the wife said at the very beginning.
segments.cn: 我们要看的第一个短语是妻子在一开始说的。

segments.en: She said we have been going around in circles for the past hour.
segments.cn: 她说我们已经转了一个小时的圈。

segments.en: Going around in circles.
So we could say we've been driving in circles.
segments.cn: 所以我们可以说我们一直在转圈。

segments.en: In circles means you've been making the same route over and over and over again.
segments.cn: 转圈意味着你一直在重复同样的路线。

segments.en: You keep seeing the same house, the same tree, the same house, the same tree.
segments.cn: 你不断看到同样的房子、同样的树、同样的房子、同样的树。

segments.en: So this means we're not going anywhere.
segments.cn: 这意味着我们没有前进。

segments.en: You could also say, Marco, I wish you had brought the map.
segments.cn: 你也可以说，马尔科，我希望你带了地图。

segments.en: We've been walking in circles for two hours.
segments.cn: 我们已经走了两个小时的圈。

segments.en: Okay, so you can use it if you're driving or if you're walking in any situation like that.
segments.cn: 好的，所以在开车或走路的任何情况下都可以使用。

segments.en: Exactly.
Okay, good.
All right, so going around in circles.
Now, moving on, the guy was a little bit irritated with her and he said something that's a little bit in place.
segments.cn: 现在，继续前进，这个家伙对她有点恼火，他说了一些不太合适的话。

segments.en: He said, you know what?
I'm going to ask for directions if it will shut your trap.
segments.cn: 如果能让你闭嘴，我就会问路。

segments.en: In polite, this is rude.
This is rude.
Yeah, this is very rude.
So be careful when you use this.
You can say, hey, shut your trap.
Okay, so shut means to close.
segments.cn: 好的，所以闭嘴意味着关闭。

segments.en: But trap, this is your mouth.
Okay, your mouth is a trap.
It's kind of like a trap.
In this case, shut your trap is a set phrase and it means shut up, be quiet, stop talking.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，闭嘴是一个固定短语，意思是闭嘴、安静、停止说话。

segments.en: So how can we say this in a nicer way?
segments.cn: 那我们怎么能更礼貌地说呢？

segments.en: For example, I've heard people say your yap.
segments.cn: 例如，我听过人们说你的嘴。

segments.en: Shut your yap.
Yeah, shut your yapper.
I would say, can you please stop talking or can we have some quiet time now?
segments.cn: 我会说，你能不能请停止说话，或者我们现在可以安静一会儿吗？

segments.en: Can we have some quiet time?
segments.cn: 我们可以安静一会儿吗？

segments.en: Yeah, that's a polite way.
The rude way is shut up.
Shut up.
Yeah.
Shut your mouth.
That's very direct though, right?
Very rude.
Yeah, that's right.
Okay.
So shut your trap.
Shut your trap.
And then the wife said, well, see, there you go.
segments.cn: 然后妻子说，好吧，看，你看。

segments.en: We got directions.
We're going to get there now.
And was that hard?
If you would only listen to me more often, you would be better off.
segments.cn: 如果你能多听我几次，你会更好。

segments.en: So the guy would be better off.
That doesn't really make much sense.
To be better off.
Okay.
So you have to think of this as a phrase, not about the individual words.
segments.cn: 所以你必须把这个当作一个短语来看，而不是单个单词。

segments.en: To be better off means to be happier or in some way better.
segments.cn: 更好意味着更快乐或在某种程度上更好。

segments.en: So, for example, if I earned more money, I think I'd be better off.
segments.cn: 例如，如果我赚更多的钱，我想我会更好。

segments.en: Okay.
Okay.
I have a nicer life.
To be happier, maybe more successful.
Right.
Right.
Or if you only listened to me, you would be better off.
segments.cn: 或者如果你能听我说，你会更好。

segments.en: It means you would make better decisions.
segments.cn: 这意味着你会做出更好的决定。

segments.en: You would have a better situation.
So I could say if she got a divorce, she would be better off.
segments.cn: 所以我可以说如果她离婚，她会更好。

segments.en: That's right.
Her life would improve.
Her life would improve.
To be better off.
This is a great, great, very useful phrase.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常有用的短语。

segments.en: Very useful.
Alright.
So why don't we listen to the dialogue for the very last time and we'll be back to talk a little bit more with you.
segments.cn: 那么我们为什么不最后一次听对话，然后再回来和你聊聊呢？

segments.en: We've been going around in circles for the past hour.
segments.cn: 我们已经转了一个小时的圈子。

segments.en: Will you just please stop and ask for directions?
We are not lost.
I'm just taking the scenic route.
Yeah, whatever.
I told you we should buy that GPS that was on sale, but would you listen to me?
segments.cn: 我告诉过你我们应该买那个打折的GPS，但你听我的吗？

segments.en: No, this is so typical.
Fine.
I'll ask this guy for directions if it will shut your trap.
segments.cn: 如果这能让你闭嘴，我就问这个人路。

segments.en: Excuse me, sir.
Can you tell me how to get to Saint Mary's Church?
segments.cn: 你能告诉我怎么去圣玛丽教堂吗？

segments.en: Sure.
Go down Park Road, turn left, go up as far as the set of traffic lights and turn left.
segments.cn: 沿着公园路走，左转，走到红绿灯处再左转。

segments.en: The place you're looking for is the second building on the right.
segments.cn: 你要找的地方是右边第二栋建筑。

segments.en: Thanks.
See, was that hard?
If you would only listen to me more often, you would be better off.
segments.cn: 如果你能多听我几次，你会过得更好。

segments.en: Alright.
So the whole thing about men asking for directions.
Why do you think men don't like to ask for directions?
segments.cn: 你觉得男人为什么不喜欢问路？

segments.en: Well, it depends on the person, but I think a lot of people don't like to admit that they don't know.
segments.cn: 嗯，这要看人，但我觉得很多人不喜欢承认自己不知道。

segments.en: Okay.
Because if you ask for directions, it means I don't know where I'm going.
segments.cn: 因为如果你问路，就意味着我不知道自己要去哪。

segments.en: I need help.
So this is one problem.
The other problem is sometimes directions are bad.
segments.cn: 另一个问题是有时候指示不准确。

segments.en: I think so too.
Sometimes when you receive an invitation or instructions on how to get to someone's house, they're very ambiguous.
segments.cn: 有时候当你收到邀请或指示去某人家时，它们非常模糊。

segments.en: They're like, you know, you pass the dog that's sitting at the corner and you're like, there's no dog.
segments.cn: 就像，你知道的，你经过坐在角落的狗，而你却发现根本没有狗。

segments.en: What?
How?
Yeah, I know.
I know someone who lives in Costa Rica and her address is go down the main street to take the second left after the post office.
segments.cn: 我认识一个住在哥斯达黎加的人，她的地址是沿着主街走，在邮局后面第二个左转。

segments.en: And after that, take the right after the general store and 400 paces is the house.
segments.cn: 然后在杂货店后面右转，走400步就是她的家。

segments.en: So there's no address.
There's no address.
It's, you know, so it happens.
segments.cn: 你知道，这种情况是会发生的。

segments.en: These instructions can be very confusing, very vague, like you said.
segments.cn: 这些指示可能非常混乱，非常模糊，就像你说的。

segments.en: So I think there's a couple, couple different problems potentially.
segments.cn: 所以我认为可能有几个不同的问题。

segments.en: I also heard a joke the other day about a kid asked his mom.
segments.cn: 我前几天听到一个笑话，一个孩子问他妈妈。

segments.en: He said, hey, why was Moses leading everyone through the desert for 40 years?
segments.cn: 他说，嘿，为什么摩西带着大家在沙漠里走了40年？

segments.en: Why?
And she's like, because he refused to ask for directions.
Funny.
I like that.
I was gonna say why?
Because he's going in circles.
All right.
So if you have any questions about today's lessons or comments, maybe you can tell us, do you like to ask for directions?
segments.cn: 如果你对今天的课程有任何问题或评论，也许你可以告诉我们，你喜欢问路吗？

segments.en: Or do you like to figure things out alone?
segments.cn: 还是你喜欢自己解决问题？

segments.en: Let us know on our website, EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 在我们的网站EnglishPod.com告诉我们。

segments.en: All right.
We'll see you guys there.
Bye.
